Articles.Content: Range. It means his craft can travel just under two hundred kilometers in dry mode before running out of fuel. For reference, mine can travel almost three throusand.
That was running in AB mode.

14 minutes ago, Joseph Kerman said:

My KSP is in Mandarin, and BDAI doesn't work there.

Just an FYI it is critical if you wish to get your craft on the roster to test it and make improvements, especially this far into competition. Your aircraft seems to have severe maneuverability/PID issues. Video will be up in a bit.

Edited December 19, 2017 by exbyde

And for our first battle of the day, we have @MrChumley's ReSoup, defending its new #5 spot from @Joseph Kerman's F-15c. The F-15 is armed to the gills with 8 AMRAAMS, 4 Sidewinders, and a vulcan cannon, yet weighs just 12 tons? So how will it do against the ReSoup?

The answer is...poorly. The F-15 appears to be a missile hauler, but can't actually haul missiles. What i mean is despite having a wealth of missiles, it only fires two at a time, meaning it enters combat with well over a ton of ammunition it will never fire. Worse off, it suffers from either a lack of mobility or debilitating PID issues, where the aircraft has trouble staying in a straight line. The result is a gunfighter that can't aim, and a missile hauler that never launches its weapons. If this was mine, i'd be setting the missiles per target to 4 at least, and maybe looking into some test fights... Great looking plane, just not a good fighter at this time.

As a reminder to all:

This is a five-man leaderboard. Many have not gotten here, many have fallen from the ranking before this, and competition is heating up. What would have made the #1 spot in the leaderboard before the break early december will no longer make the leaderboards at all. It is critical that you test your aircraft with BDA Autopilot battles against other ranked aircraft if you wish to place on the ranking board. At this point in the game, an untested aircraft is essentially guaranteed not to make rank if it has not been tested in BDA autopilot battles.

I know many of you test your aircraft meticulously, and this message is not necessarily for you, but i do still see submissions that are far from competitive because they were not tested.

Edited December 19, 2017 by exbyde

2 hours ago, l0kki said:

I would actually like to add that the F-15 suffers from a lack of maneuverability meaning it cant get a second volley of missiles off making it have 8 missiles worth of drag and excess weight

Maneuverability is not as critical if you rout the enemy. Launching more missiles has a higher probability of keeping the enemy running, meaning the chance of an enemy fighter retaliating drops pretty close to zero and you can get on their tails with guns with minimal effort. Even 3v2 is better odds.

1 hour ago, exbyde said:

Maneuverability is not as critical if you rout the enemy. Launching more missiles has a higher probability of keeping the enemy running, meaning the chance of an enemy fighter retaliating drops pretty close to zero and you can get on their tails with guns with minimal effort. Even 3v2 is better odds.

Looking at the footage the F-15 was having problems turning for another missile pass although i agree that launching more than 2 missiles would be advantageous

It's technically the X-02 Taisch Mk XI, but there have been enough changes as to render it more or less a completely new airframe, so lets call it the X-03 Strigoi and go from there. It's been tested against the ReSoup and MiniVal and held its own, at least on my end. It's not the most maneuverable craft seen here, but makes up for that in... other ways.
